And one where underlying ideals are about giving everyone an opportunity to be prosperous.

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowning descision made by director Vincent Ward is the complete lack of any English speakers. A dialect even I could understand would have helped the audience to feel some connection to Cara Brace (Kerry Fox), but most of Ward's cast members offer up very little more than grunts and facial expressions.

The only reason I am commenting is because I finally figured out why Dr. Cox was bald. Although we probably all realized it at the same time this week Dr. Cox is bald because he has Raynaud's syndrome. If you look carefully every time he is disgusted, annoyed, or stressed you can see his finger tips go white.
